p: Vanillic acid is present in various fruits, cereal grains, olives, and different plants, along with beer, cider, wine [ 38, 39], Gardeniae fructus [ 40], potato [ 41], red propolis [ 42], palm plant [ 43], Juglans regia [ 44], Angelica sinensis [ 45, 46], Chenopodium murale [ 47], pumpkin seeds [ 48], Melilotus messanensis [ 49], orchard grass [ 50], and Poliomintha longiflora [ 51]. Vanillic acid is commonly used in different food preservatives, additives and flavoring agents and in the perfume industry [ 52]. It also plays an important role in protein and fatty acid biosynthesis [ 53]. Vanillic acid is applied as an antibacterial agent [ 54, 55]; is a natural antioxidant in vegetables, fruits, and other plants [ 44, 56]; is also used in antiapoptotic, hypotensive, hepatoprotective, cardioprotective roles and in the regulation of genes [ 57, 58, 59]. It is also commonly used in prescriptive Chinese drug [ 60]. Although vanillic acid has been identified in different plants and its allelopathic activity is well documented [ 61, 62, 63, 64, 65], this is the first report on vanillic acid from Wedelia chinensis.
